page.title: 14An elderly resident
page.content: We went to Bakers' Piece House which are flats for elderly people. We met Mrs Davis who is eighty four years old. When she was a little girl she came to Aston Rowant School. Mrs Green was the head teacher. She used to smack the children. There was a room for big children and one for the small ones. They did a lot of sewing, particularly samplers. Mrs Davis still has some that she did in 1910 to 1913. They also did arithmetic and writing. They never did ay PE or games because there was not enough room. If the children wanted a drink of water they ha go to a house further down School Lane. Mrs Davis had to walk about three miles to school every day. All the children in the school were aged from 7 to 13. The younger children went to the Infant School which was in Kingston.
